data_expiry.description: Number of days that hashed data (passwords and DOM hashes) are cached

display_reuse_alerts.description: Trigger alert pop-up notifications for the user when a password reuse is detected

enable_debug_gui.description: Allow users access to the debug GUI. This is particularly useful in the initial rollout stages to test different configurations.

enterprise_domains.description: Domains where corporate passwords are approved to be entered

faq_link.description: Link to a FAQ explaining what PhishCatch does

ignored_domains.description: Domains which will be ignored by the extension

manual_password_entry.description: Enable the manual password entry button

pbkdf2_iterations.description: Number of pbkdf2 iterations to perform when hashing passwords. Don't change this unless you know what you're doing

hash_truncation_amount.description: Number of characters to truncate saved hashes by

key.description: Preshared key as configured on the PhishCatch server

repo_link.description: Link to the PhishCatch source code, for intrepid users

url_sanitization_level.description: Default level of sanitization to perform before reporting URL to server

expire_hash_on_use.description: Remove matching hashes when an alert is triggered. This is useful if the extension can't always detect password resets.

username_regexes.description: Custom regexes to define the form of usernames so that passwords don't slip in

username_selectors.description: Custom selectors to find usernames on a login page

banned_urls.description: Banned URLs. Phishcatch will prevent the user from interacting with these pages.
